you use hot wire cutters and cut out foam which you need the tools you need

going to help me get it all around this pile here
and I keep it there roughly the same shape all right so that looks pretty

go ahead and you my white glue again my glue all and put

saturate the bottom I didn't glue this to the bottom and that's really not

all right so now I've got that cutout now I've got the paper on the bottom

all right so now I'm going to take my hot glue gun and give a generous helping

and like I said you could draw that right right on there flush so I'm going

I'm going to use my white glue okay my PVA glue and I'm going to add some piles

you so in this photo I've gone two steps I

in this setup I have a cave tile with the stone set on there and they blend in

and then you could have the say you had some enemies in there and they could
jump out from behind the rocks and one nice thing about these two is I did for
playability was that you could stand figures on them okay so I always try to
think about the playability of objects that I make so there's one set up you
could use these for here we have a nice Overland setup and you can see I have
the Sun set out with so long with some plants and say our characters go along
and they feel some perception checks they're going through a area with stones
and then you know the same thing happens the lizard folk or whatever come out and
I really I really want to stress I like that that you can put guys on the stones
because they can you know defend someone tries to get up on the stone they could
defend against someone trying to get up there that's a nice defensible point I
always try to think about playability when I make this stuff you can also
scale this up very easily so you could stack cardboard and do toilet paper on
it that kind of things you could make any size stones you wanted or any shape
with this technique very cheaply and quickly and let's give you a look at the
stone here another close-up see how nice that that variation of color in the
stone wash really gave it it makes it look like a stone it really came out
nice and then that highlighted dolphin gray was just enough to pick out the
